column4: Hi I could really use someone to help me with a few things - I am at the end of the line here folks - I have vowed to get my ubuntu installation working my noon or I forget the whole thing and my machines go back to windows - I could really use the help.
BY NOON is had better work
It's that simple
I do mean that
No Ubuntu is installed
It's just getting it to do the simplist of things
I could use someone 'personally' who can help me along the way when doing things
So bollox to it
what takes time is not the doing, it's the learning. don't put deadlines like that ;)
dual boot. take your time to figure out linux. It took me a long time to adopt it fulltime
try to be a little less "urgent" in your dealings. You might have better luck
if you are not "urgent" as you say in this channel YOU GET IGNORED
not really...  your CAPS usage might cause that though
bot answers are for common things. If they exist, it's to not have to explain the exact same things over and over. Most people are happy to be pointed in the right direction
if you actually a need of one of the new features, sure you can do it but I doubt that's the case
- I do need one of the new features
what? maybe you can just grab the dapper kernel. not sure if it's as easy as that though

note that I don't actually know if this will work.   just change the sources.list lines  from breezy to dapper.   install the kernel (make sure you don't upgrade the whole system) and revert to the old sources.list
- hey I installed the 2.6.15 one - but its not showing in the GRUB menu - do I need to add it ?
it doesn't show up in grub? it should....   if not you might need to add it yourself to /boot/grub/menu.lst
what package did you install exactly?
you upgraded  linux-686  or something like that?
- ummm it's not in /boot
